title: Commemorating the 50th Anniversary of the Floyd Volunteer Fire Department and Ladies Auxiliary
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commemorating the 50th Anniversary of the Floyd
Volunteer Fire Department and Ladies Auxiliary

WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is proud to commemorate the 50th Anniver-
sary of the Floyd Volunteer Fire Department and Ladies Auxiliary, and to
honor its past and present firefighting members for  50  years  of  fire
protection to the citizens of Floyd, New York; and
  WHEREAS,  The auspicious occasion of the 50th Anniversary of the Floyd
Volunteer Fire Department and Ladies Auxiliary will be celebrated at the
Department's Annual Installation Banquet, to be held on Saturday, Febru-
ary 12, 2011, at the Radisson Hotel,  200  Genesee  Street,  Utica,  New
York; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Floyd Volunteer Fire Department was established in 1961
and provides fire, rescue, and first medical services to the citizens of
Floyd, New York; 100 charter members joined the Department in its  first
year, forming the original membership roster; and
  WHEREAS,  The  first  meeting  of  the Floyd Volunteer Fire Department
Ladies Auxiliary was held at the Floyd Town Hall on November  16,  1961;
37  women were present and are considered the charter members and found-
ers of the Auxiliary; and
  WHEREAS, The main function of the Auxiliary is to offer assistance  to
the  people  of  the  community  who have suffered a fire loss; over the
years, the Auxiliary has become an integral part of the Floyd  Volunteer
Fire  Department  both  within the District and in the surrounding area;
and
  WHEREAS, Fire departments are an integral part of community protection
services in every locality of our State; during the past 50  years,  the
courageous  and devoted firefighters of the Floyd Volunteer Fire Depart-
ment in Floyd, New York, have valiantly responded to all types  of  fire
emergencies  and  have won the praise and respect of the community which
they serve; and
  WHEREAS, In addition, for the benefit of the community, in the  spring
of 2004, the Floyd Volunteer Fire Department decided to award any gradu-
ating  senior  that resides in the Town of Floyd a scholarship to a four
year college; and
  WHEREAS, With a membership of dedicated firefighters,  the  record  of
the   Floyd  Volunteer  Fire  Department  in  public  service  and  fire
protection is one to be envied; for 24 hours a day, for 365 days a year,
for 50 years, whenever the alarm sounded, these  noble  volunteers  left
their homes and went to the aid of their neighbors; and
  WHEREAS, The brave firefighters of the Floyd Volunteer Fire Department
are  prepared  to  risk  their lives every day to help save the lives of
others and to protect homes and property from the destruction caused  by
fire; and
  WHEREAS,  In addition to the skill and devoted service demonstrated by
individual firefighters, the Floyd Volunteer  Fire  Department  reflects
the history and development of firefighting over the past 50 years; and
  WHEREAS,  This Legislative Body cannot express sufficient gratitude to
those devoted individuals who recognize that the  preservation  of  life
and property is a sacred responsibility and who make that responsibility
their own by serving as firefighters; and
  WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body that we should give
special recognition to those who work so assiduously for the  betterment
of  their  communities,  and  acknowledge publicly the heroic good works
performed by the volunteer fire departments of this great Empire  State,
their officers and auxiliaries; now, therefore, be it

  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
proudly commemorate the 50th Anniversary of  the  Floyd  Volunteer  Fire
Department and Ladies Auxiliary; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted  to  the  Floyd  Volunteer Fire Department and Ladies Auxiliary,
8367 Old Floyd Road, Rome, New York 13440.
